channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: EU takes Elon Musk's X to court over blue checks and ads
item.description: The European Union has charged Elon Musk’s X with violating new regulations for social media platforms. Musk faces hefty fines over delivering misinformation.
item.content:encoded:
The European Union has charged Elon Musk’s X with violating new regulations for social media platforms. Musk faces hefty fines over delivering misinformation.

(Image credit: Alain Jocard)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: Judge throws out case against Alec Baldwin
item.description: Baldwin and his family broke down in tears in the courtroom.
item.content:encoded:
Baldwin and his family broke down in tears in the courtroom.

(Image credit: Ramsay de Give)
item.dc:creator: Clare Lombardo

item.title: Judge dismisses actor Alec Baldwin's involuntary manslaughter trial
item.description: A judge in New Mexico has dismissed the involuntary manslaughter trial of actor Alec Baldwin. He'd been charged for the 2021 shooting of cinematographer Halyna Hutchins on the set of the movie Rust.
item.content:encoded: A judge in New Mexico has dismissed the involuntary manslaughter trial of actor Alec Baldwin. He'd been charged for the 2021 shooting of cinematographer Halyna Hutchins on the set of the movie Rust.
item.dc:creator: Mandalit del Barco

item.title: Howard students help a rapper request a new trial after lyrics were used as evidence
item.description: California rap artist Ronnie Louvier will soon find out if his 2009 murder conviction will be overturned under the Racial Justice Act. He said his rap lyrics shouldn’t have been used in the case.
item.content:encoded: California rap artist Ronnie Louvier will soon find out if his 2009 murder conviction will be overturned under the Racial Justice Act. He said his rap lyrics shouldn’t have been used in the case.
item.dc:creator: Kristin Wright

item.title: The music Industry is coming for AI
item.description: A new lawsuit filed by record labels Universal, Sony and Warner says their catalogs have been ripped off by two AI music generators. But there’s a twist: It’s not clear the courts are on their side.
item.content:encoded: A new lawsuit filed by record labels Universal, Sony and Warner says their catalogs have been ripped off by two AI music generators. But there’s a twist: It’s not clear the courts are on their side.
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: Colorado has approved licenses for outdoor preschools, making them more accessible
item.description: A new law opens up outdoor preschools to low income families in Colorado by allowing them to accept state child care subsidies. Advocates say learning outdoors has advantages over indoor classrooms.
item.content:encoded: A new law opens up outdoor preschools to low income families in Colorado by allowing them to accept state child care subsidies. Advocates say learning outdoors has advantages over indoor classrooms.
item.dc:creator: Jenny Brundin

item.title: What NPR's poll says about the state of Biden's campaign
item.description: President Biden doubled down on his decision to stay in the presidential race at Thursday's press conference. It was a solid performance, but he made some notable gaffes.
item.content:encoded: President Biden doubled down on his decision to stay in the presidential race at Thursday's press conference. It was a solid performance, but he made some notable gaffes.
item.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro

item.title: Why older leaders seem resistant to passing the torch
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers talks with journalist and writer Rebecca Traister about America's aging political leaders and gerontocracy in the U.S.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Juana Summers talks with journalist and writer Rebecca Traister about America's aging political leaders and gerontocracy in the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Erika Ryan

item.title: 2 galaxies, the Penguin and the Egg, get a family portrait thanks to Webb Telescope
item.description: The galaxies' fanciful names belie their actual ages: In this case of the Penguin and the Egg, it’s the Egg that came first.
item.content:encoded:
The galaxies' fanciful names belie their actual ages: In this case of the Penguin and the Egg, it’s the Egg that came first.

(Image credit: NASA, ESA, CSA, STScI)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: How to invest like Congress
item.description: Traders are using publicly available data to track which lawmakers are reporting big stock market gains. We try to copy them.
item.content:encoded: Traders are using publicly available data to track which lawmakers are reporting big stock market gains. We try to copy them.
item.dc:creator: Wailin Wong
